meanings.definition: Capable of being switched or changed.
meanings.sent1: The light bulb is switchable, meaning you can turn it on and off easily.
meanings.sent2: The TV remote has a switchable button for changing channels.
meanings.sent3: I wish my mood was switchable like the lights in my room.
meanings.sent4: Her opinion on the matter was as switchable as the weather in spring.
meanings.sent5: The switchable nature of the weather made planning a picnic challenging.

meanings.definition: Able to be turned on or off.
meanings.sent1: The switchable fan provided relief on hot days.
meanings.sent2: The switchable alarm clock woke me up at the right time every morning.
meanings.sent3: The switchable night light made the room feel cozy.
meanings.sent4: His interest in the topic was as switchable as a light switch.
meanings.sent5: The switchable nature of the heater kept the room at a comfortable temperature.

meanings.definition: Having the ability to alternate between different options.
meanings.sent1: The switchable phone case allowed me to change its color whenever I wanted.
meanings.sent2: The switchable settings on the camera made it versatile for different lighting conditions.
meanings.sent3: Her outfit was so switchable, she could go from casual to formal in seconds.
meanings.sent4: The switchable nature of the car's seats made long drives more comfortable.
meanings.sent5: The switchable menu at the restaurant offered a variety of choices for customers.
